Text editor for html, css and javascript files

slides.title: Tools
bullets: All professional development should test on real devices from all targeted platforms
Two important factors that can't easily be emulated are how the page "feels" and network latency/speed

slides.title: Differentiation
bullets: So now that you know, that action to take?
CSS styles from CSS3 Media Queries or with help of Modernizr etc
JavaScript to hide/show different parts and take different actions
Always let the user choose the other version

slides.title: Setting the viewport
bullets: Almost the only mobile-specific thing you'll put in a web page
width, height in pixels or device-width or device-height

slides.title: HTML safe for usage
bullets: Almost all HTML elements work fine
More differences in ui for some field types
Input of type file (upload) only works on newer Android devices
Remember that typing text on a mobile device always is more difficult!
